InstallationÂ¶

  1. You may need to manually point your system to python3. You can check this by typing python in the command line and seeing if it is running python3. At this time, RiboPipe only works when Python3 is set as the default. If it is not, do the following:
$ echo "alias python="python3" >> ~/.bash_profile
  1. Download Conda, a package manager, for your operating system. Double click the .pkg file if on MacOS, the .exe file on Windows, or follow these instructions on Linux.
  2. Install XPRESStools and associated dependencies via conda:
$ conda install -y -c bioconda xpresstools
  1. Or download XPRESStools manually:
$ git clone https://github.com/XPRESSyourself/xpresstools.git
$ cd XPRESStools
$ cd python setup.py install
  1. Or, to download specific version:
$ tag='v0.0.1-beta'
$ wget https://github.com/XPRESSyourself/XPRESStools/archive/$tag.zip
$ unzip xpresstools-${tag:1}.zip
$ mv xpresstools-${tag:1} xpresstools
$ cd xpresstools
$ cd python setup.py install
  1. At the end of the installation instructions, an installation location will be given. Add this to your $PATH:
...
Installing xpresstools script to /Users/$USERNAME/anaconda3/bin

Installed /Users/$USERNAME/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/xpresstools-0.0.1b0-py3.6.egg
Processing dependencies for XPRESStools==0.0.1b0
Finished processing dependencies for XPRESStools==0.0.1b0

$ echo "export PATH='/Users/$USERNAME/anaconda3/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bash_profile
